task.title: How to withdraw money from an ATM
task.shortdesc: The procedure illustrated below will walk through the steps of withdrawing cash from an ATM.

taskbody.prereq: You must possess an active debit or ATM card along with the correct 4 digit PIN.

context.p: There may be small variations in the withdrawal process depending on the software used by different banks.

step.cmd: Look for an illustration on the ATM on how to insert the card. Insert your ATM or debit card face up into the card slot, usually indicated by a green blinking light.
Select your language. Selection can be done either by tapping the text on the screen (in case of touch screen ATMs) or by pressing the button next to the text on the screen.
Enter your PIN (Personal Identification Number), which is usually a 4-digit code specific to the card you inserted using the keypad.
Press Enter on the keypad. Upon entering the correct PIN, you will be directed to a menu.
Press Withdraw from the menu. Another menu is displayed asking you to select your account type.
Press Savings for personal accounts or Current if you hold a business account.
Enter the amount you want to withdraw using the keypad and then press Enter.
The ATM will ask if you want a receipt. Press Yes if you want a printed receipt of your transaction or Press No if a printed receipt is unnecessary.

Wait for the ATM to complete your transaction. The cash is ejected from a slot below the screen. Take the cash out. NOTE: There is a timer for you to successfully accept the cash. Upon expiry of timer, the cash is automatically reclaimed by the ATM.
The ATM will ask you if youâ€™d like to make another transaction. Press Yes if you want to check your balance or make another withdrawal, etc. Press No if there are no more transactions to be made.
The ATM will eject your card. Remove card from slot and store safely.

taskbody.result: Cash will be dispensed by the ATM at the end of the transaction.
